chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
Donald Donnell Alford-Lofton was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald Donnell Alford-Lofton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury Trial held on May 17, 2022. Exhibit 1 - Thumb drive is not scannable, stored in COC.
Copy of minutes from JT Hrg on 5/17/22 sent electronically to DCJ
Not Guilty

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Day 1 of jury trial. Parties take up preliminary issues prior to bringing the jury in. Jury brought in at 9:02 am. Jury sworn in at 9:03 am. Court begins with preliminary jury instructions. State gives opening statement. Atty Breun gives opening statement. Court breaks at 9:28 am. Back on the record at 9:40 am, appearances are the same as before. Witness D.W. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Exhibit 1 is marked, offered and received. Atty Breun with cross exam. Witness is excused and released from subponea. Witness J.L. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Atty Breun with cross exam. Witness is excused and released from subponea. Court breaks at 11:02 am. Back on the record at 11:19 am, appearances are the same as before. Witness P.L. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Witness identified the defendant. Atty Breun with cross exam. Witness is excused and released from subponea. Witness T.S. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Atty Breun with cross exam. Witness is excused and released from subponea. State rests. Atty Breun motions the court for a dismissal and gives argument. Court makes findings and denies the motion to dismiss. Court breaks at 11:59 am. Back on the record at 1:00 pm, appearances are the same as before. Court completes a colloquy with the DE regarding testifying on his own behalf. DE has elected to not testify and the court accepts the waiver. Parties discuss the closing jury instructions. Defense rests. Evidence is closed. Court gives final jury instructions. State with closing argument. Atty Breun with closing argument. State with rebuttal argument. Juror #11 is dismissed from deliberations. Court gives final instructions. Bailiff sworn in at 2:05 pm. Jury sent to deliberations at 2:05 pm. Court breaks at 2:07 pm. Back on the record at 3:00 pm, appearances are the same as before. Jury has advised they have reached a verdict. Verdict is not guilty. Atty Breun moves for judgment on the verdict. Court grants judgment on the verdict. DE is release from bond conditions.
Final closing jury instructions
Preliminary jury instructions-Final version
from the Court regarding proposed closing instructions and proposed verdict forms

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for jury selection. Court takes up preliminary issues prospective jurors brought in at 9:00 am. Prospective jurors sworn in at 9:05 am. Court begins with voir dire. State with voir dire. Atty Breun with voir dire. Juror 17 is struck for cause. Premptory challenges done at 10:17 am. Jury selected. Jurors not selected are dismissed at 10:21 am. State did not file preliminary jury instructions or motions in limine. As to defense motion's in limine, with no objection from the state, they are all granted with the exception of #5. #4 is granted, however some further issues will be discussed tomorrow. Parties discuss the preliminary jury instructions and decide the final version.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No Ludwig hearing. Witness lists and motions in limine due by end of the day May 12, 2022. Jury will have 1 alternate. 23 Jurors in the the box with 5 strikes per side. Any stipulated facts are to be submitted in writing and signed by both parties. Parties agree to not having a transcript for the states audio evidence. Court will proceed to trial with selection beginning on Monday May 16, 2022.
